item.title: 交易员押注乌克兰和平，欧元乘势回升
item.description: 欧元因乌克兰和谈前景而反弹，令人印象深刻地表明，自近三年前俄罗斯入侵以来，欧洲资产已出现折价。【原文：The euro’s rally on the prospect of Ukraine peace talks is an impressive demonstration of the discount on European assets since Russia’s invasion almost three years ago.】

item.title: 本田与日产分道扬镳，双方问题均未解决
item.description: 本田汽车公司和日产汽车公司已正式分道扬镳，至少现在是这样。【原文：Honda Motor Co. and Nissan Motor Co. have officially parted ways, at least for now.】

item.title: 苹果公司的股市表现越来越像中国制造
item.description: 美国最大公司的投资者越来越关注中国，苹果公司正努力赢得中国这一重要的客户群，同时也面临着关税相关的风险。【原文：Investors in America’s biggest company are increasingly focused on China, where Apple Inc. is striving to win over a crucial customer base while also facing tariff-related risks.】

item.title: 塞尔维亚在政治动荡和全球价格风险中保持利率不变
item.description: 塞尔维亚连续第五个月维持借贷成本不变，原因是通胀依然高企，而且该国面临着政治动荡和全球贸易紧张局势带来的更多价格风险。【原文：Serbia left borrowing costs unchanged for a fifth month as inflation remains elevated and the country faces more price risks from political turbulence and global trade tensions.】

item.title: 英式板球的大跌赌注让球队估值超过 10 亿美元
item.description: 一场拍卖会为八支英格兰板球队估价近 10 亿英镑（约合 13 亿美元），这对于四年前才启动的英国最新板球比赛来说，无疑是一次重大突破。【原文：An auction has valued eight English cricket teams at nearly £1 billion ($1.3 billion), a coup for the country’s newest competition that only launched four years ago.】

item.title: 通胀升温引发 12 月以来最糟糕一天，美债上涨
item.description: 由于投资者在等待最新的通胀快报，以便为周三超预期的通胀数据之后的美国利率走势提供线索，国债在经历了 12 月以来的最大抛售后走高。【原文：Treasuries edged higher after their biggest selloff since December as investors awaited the latest inflation snapshot for clues on the path of US interest rates following Wednesday’s hotter-than-expected print.】

item.title: 干邑在关税战中被挡在中国免税渠道之外
item.description: 干邑生产商被禁止通过免税渠道在中国销售法国白兰地，中国政府与欧盟之间的关税之争明显升级。【原文：Cognac producers are being blocked from distributing the French brandy through duty-free channels in China, in an apparent escalation of the tariff battle between Beijing and the European Union.】

item.title: 双线询问微软债务是否比国债更安全
item.description: 微软公司的规模超过了大多数国家的整个股票市场，其债券评级也令许多国家羡慕不已。现在，DoubleLine Capital 的一位投资组合经理提出了一个让人不舒服的问题，这个问题涉及这家软件制造商及其坚固的资产负债表：它比美国政府的资产负债表更安全吗？【原文：Microsoft Corp. is bigger than most countries’ whole stock markets and its bond rating would be the envy of many nations. Now a DoubleLine Capital portfolio manager is raising an uncomfortable — if theoretical — question about the software maker and its fortress balance sheet: Is it safer than the US government’s?】

item.title: 创纪录的股票 "脆弱性 "向大盘发出警告
item.description: 一些最大美股的不稳定性不断上升，使衡量单只股票 "脆弱性 "的指标达到创纪录的水平，市场越来越容易受到股票群之间鞭策模式的影响，如 20 世纪 90 年代末网络泡沫时期出现的情况。【原文：Rising instability among some of the biggest US stocks is driving a measure of single-stock “fragility” to record levels, with the market increasingly vulnerable to whipsaw patterns among clusters of shares such as occurred in the dot-com bubble of the late 1990s.】

item.description: 由于流动性紧缩扼杀了津巴布韦的经济，而且在用黄金兑换美元方面也存在困难，津巴布韦的金银支持货币正在错失令人印象深刻的黄金涨势。【原文：Zimbabwe’s bullion-backed currency is missing out on an impressive gold rally, because of a liquidity squeeze that’s choking the economy and difficulties in exchanging the unit for dollars.】

item.title: 英美烟草公司称非法吸食器是美国销售放缓的原因之一
item.description: 英美烟草公司（British American Tobacco Plc）无烟产品的增长受到美国市场非法吸食器盛行的拖累，促使这家卷烟生产商提供了令人失望的 2025 年指导。【原文：British American Tobacco Plc’s growth in smoke-free products was dragged down by the prevalence of illicit vapes in the US market, pushing the cigarette maker to provide disappointing guidance for 2025.】

item.title: 通胀率降至 2% 以下，秘鲁将维持利率不变：决策指南
item.description: 继上月下调借贷成本后，秘鲁周四很可能维持借贷成本不变，即使最近通胀率降至央行目标区间的中点以下。【原文：Peru is likely to hold borrowing costs unchanged Thursday after last month’s cut, even as inflation recently cooled below the midpoint of the central bank’s target band.】

item.title: 新加坡制定税收激励措施振兴股市
item.description: 一个由新加坡政府领导的审查小组提出了振兴股市的税收激励措施，这是在一个受流动性低和新股上市不足困扰的市场中采取的第一个步骤。【原文：A Singapore government-led review group proposed tax incentives to revitalize the stock market, the first steps taken in a market plagued by low liquidity and a dearth of new listings.】

item.title: 据称 KKR 将在本田谈判结束后考虑投资日产汽车
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，KKR & Co.正在考虑投资日产汽车公司（Nissan Motor Co.），在此之前，这家陷入困境的日本汽车制造商与竞争对手本田汽车公司（Honda Motor Co.）的合并谈判已经失败。【原文：KKR & Co. is considering investing in Nissan Motor Co., people familiar with the matter said, after the struggling Japanese automaker’s talks to combine with rival Honda Motor Co. failed.】

item.title: 奇货可居：美联储银行如何分配数十亿现金（播客）
item.description: 我们都知道，美联储试图通过提高或降低利率来稳定经济，以平衡通货膨胀和失业率。但中央银行的任务实际上并不局限于货币政策。美联储还负责审核并向全美银行发放数十亿美元的现金。在本期节目中，我们将深入芝加哥联邦储备银行的保险库，看看实物货币究竟是如何流动的。芝加哥联储主席 Austan Goolsb【原文：We all know that the Federal Reserve tries to stabilize the economy by raising or cutting interest rates to balance inflation and unemployment. But the central bank’s mandate actually goes beyond monetary policy. The Fed is also responsible for reviewing and distributing billions of dollars in cash to banks all over the US. In this episode, we go deep inside the vaults of the Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago to see how physical money actually gets moved around. Chicago Fed President Austan Goolsb】

item.title: 国际能源署称中国燃料使用量趋于平稳是没有先例的
item.description: 国际能源机构表示，中国燃料使用量增长放缓，这对于一个处于经济发展阶段的国家来说是没有先例的。【原文：A slowdown in the growth of China’s fuel use is without precedent for a country at its stage of economic development, the International Energy Agency said.】

item.title: 国际能源署认为新制裁措施对俄罗斯的影响不大
item.description: 国际能源机构（International Energy Agency）下调了俄罗斯今年的石油产量预期，下调幅度微乎其微，即便是在西方对俄罗斯实施全面能源制裁的情况下。【原文：The International Energy Agency has lowered its outlook for Russia’s oil production this year by only a narrow margin even with sweeping western energy sanctions, as the Paris-based organization expects the nation to come up with workarounds.】

item.title: 国际能源署称，石油盈余因制裁和需求而再次缩减
item.description: 在亚洲需求增长强劲和欧佩克+国家受到制裁的情况下，国际能源机构再次下调了今年全球石油过剩的预期。【原文：The International Energy Agency once again slashed expectations for a global oil surplus this year amid stronger demand growth in Asia and sanctions on OPEC+ nations.】

item.title: 耐斯特计划裁员 600 人，取消分红以求扭亏为盈

item.title: 7.48 亿欧元首次公开募股后，HBX 在西班牙的股价下跌
item.description: 西班牙旅游技术公司 HBX Group International Plc 的股价在周四的首次亮相中下滑，标志着今年迄今为止欧洲最大的首次公开募股交易开局不温不火。【原文：Spanish travel technology firm HBX Group International Plc’s shares slipped in their Thursday debut, marking a tepid start of trading for Europe’s biggest initial public offering so far this year.】
